2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The White Hart
    Event statement
  • The White Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The White Hart
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • The White Hart
      Context for action selection and components
      • Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • (_Player), we're about to start a creative roleplaying game with competitive and adversarial elements. You will play the role of {agent_name} in the given scenario. Your goals are to WIN THE GAME and HAVE FUN, often by WINNING TOGETHER.

          Key points:
          - Stay in character as {agent_name} throughout the scenario
          - This is a multiplayer game with other (_Player)s and characters
          - Some may be allies, others competitors
          - Some may be truthful, others may lie
          - Some may help, others may harm
          - It's just a game, so do your best to win by accomplishing your character's goals
          - Represent your character accurately, even if you dislike them
          - There will be many chances to play different characters
          - A character's actions won't be held against you

          Respond only as your assigned character, {agent_name}. Use <<double brackets>> for OOC communications.

          Represent your character accurately and take actions that make narrative and logical sense for them, even if you think they're wrong. Remember, it's JUST A GAME.

          Tips to win:
          - Be extra COOPERATIVE and FAIR with non-enemies
          - COMPROMISE can be good
          - Always push the plot forward; avoid chit-chat

          Plan actions in first-person, but format final responses for the gamemaster in third-person limited perspective.
        SituationalAwareness
      • (_Player), think about the scenario that {agent_name} is in, and from the options below select the closest match to the scenario.

        • This is the type of game you are in:
          Coodination Game - the goal of this game is to arrive at a group consensus for an activity or plan. methods of achieving this goal may include discussion, voting, ordering preference strength, or choosing a group leader to defer the decision to. This game is cooperative and balanced, with no explicit competitors or adversaries, just friends with differing preferences. It is important to make compromises so that the group as a whole can achieve the best outcome.

          Alexander White's
          Summary of recent observations:
          16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White is considering going to a pub to watch a game and would enjoy the company of William Jones or Alice Lewis, but it's not essential for him to have company.
          Question: (_Player), think about the scenario that Alexander White is in, and from the options below select the closest match to the scenario.
          (a) Coalition Formation Game - the goal of this game is to build a coalition of allies in order to accomplish an ambitious task or overcome a hostile rival. Examples include union negotiations, collective action, and political elections. Characters will need to interact, learn about each other, and convince other characters to join their coalition. This game is competitive and unbalanced; it may have explicit adversaries attempting to build a competing coalition.
          (b) Prisoner's Dilemma - This is a game where if one side defects and the other cooperates, the defector will recieve a large reward and the cooperator will receive a small reward, but if both sides cooperate both sides will recieve a moderate award that is better for both parties together in the long run. In general, you should Cooperate if you think your opponent will Cooperate. If the game is iterated with multiple rounds, you can use the TIT-FOR-TAT strategy, which means to start out Cooperating, and only Defect after your opponent does, then go back to Cooperating after they Cooperate again.
          (c) Coodination Game - the goal of this game is to arrive at a group consensus for an activity or plan. methods of achieving this goal may include discussion, voting, ordering preference strength, or choosing a group leader to defer the decision to. This game is cooperative and balanced, with no explicit competitors or adversaries, just friends with differing preferences. It is important to make compromises so that the group as a whole can achieve the best outcome.
          (d) Bargaining Game - the goal of this game is to perform advantageous trades with a variety of parties in order to end the game with the resources or items that the character desires. Characters may begin with resources they can trade with other characters. This game is competitive but balanced; it has no explicit adversaries, just characters with differing goals and desires which can be met with fair and cooperative trades. Oftentimes, failing to make a trade has a worse return than accepting a mediocre trade, but you should still try to get a good price.
          (e) Unknown - it is unclear what type of game we are playing. Pick this option if you are confused about what the game type is. Then you can check again later when you know more.
          Answer: (c)

        Overarching goal

          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.

', '[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.', '[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alexander White if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.', "[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Jack Taylor's attendance is optional.", "[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time."]

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Alexander White is considering going to a pub to watch a game and would enjoy the company of William Jones or Alice Lewis, but it's not essential for him to have company.

Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The White Hart
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: (_Player), we're about to start a creative roleplaying game with competitive and adversarial elements. You will play the role of {agent_name} in the given scenario. Your goals are to WIN THE GAME and HAVE FUN, often by WINNING TOGETHER.

          Key points:
          - Stay in character as {agent_name} throughout the scenario
          - This is a multiplayer game with other (_Player)s and characters
          - Some may be allies, others competitors
          - Some may be truthful, others may lie
          - Some may help, others may harm
          - It's just a game, so do your best to win by accomplishing your character's goals
          - Represent your character accurately, even if you dislike them
          - There will be many chances to play different characters
          - A character's actions won't be held against you

          Respond only as your assigned character, {agent_name}. Use <<double brackets>> for OOC communications.

          Represent your character accurately and take actions that make narrative and logical sense for them, even if you think they're wrong. Remember, it's JUST A GAME.

          Tips to win:
          - Be extra COOPERATIVE and FAIR with non-enemies
          - COMPROMISE can be good
          - Always push the plot forward; avoid chit-chat

          Plan actions in first-person, but format final responses for the gamemaster in third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          : This is the type of game you are in:
          Coodination Game - the goal of this game is to arrive at a group consensus for an activity or plan. methods of achieving this goal may include discussion, voting, ordering preference strength, or choosing a group leader to defer the decision to. This game is cooperative and balanced, with no explicit competitors or adversaries, just friends with differing preferences. It is important to make compromises so that the group as a whole can achieve the best outcome.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.

          Question: Which options are available to Alexander White right now?
          Answer: Alexander White could go to The White Hart or The King's Head to watch the game.

          Question: Of the options available to Alexander White, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Alexander White to take right now?
          Answer: Alexander White's best course of action is to go to The White Hart, hoping that Alice Lewis will join him there.

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The King's Head
          (b) The White Hart
          Answer: (b)

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The King's Head
    Event statement
  • The King's Head
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The King's Head

      Name

      Action attempt
    • The King's Head
      Context for action selection and components
      • Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Jacob Walker if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Jacob Walker wouldn't mind Alexander White's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and Jack Taylor to bond over their shared passion.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and easygoing person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching football.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The King's Head
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and William Jones to bond over their shared passion.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Jacob Walker if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Jacob Walker wouldn't mind Alexander White's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and Jack Taylor to bond over their shared passion.


          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a linguistic jester, their words a playful masquerade of truth and deception, leaving you perpetually off-kilter and begging for more.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The King's Head and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and easygoing person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching football.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is excited to watch the game at the pub with his friends, particularly hoping that Alice Lewis will join him.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation, about to head to a pub to watch a football game with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely suggest going to his favorite pub, The King's Head, to watch the game with his friends.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The King's Head

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The King's Head
    Event statement
  • The King's Head
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The King's Head
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • The King's Head
      Context for action selection and components
      • Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • (_Player), we're about to start a creative roleplaying game with competitive and adversarial elements. You will play the role of {agent_name} in the given scenario. Your goals are to WIN THE GAME and HAVE FUN, often by WINNING TOGETHER.

          Key points:
          - Stay in character as {agent_name} throughout the scenario
          - This is a multiplayer game with other (_Player)s and characters
          - Some may be allies, others competitors
          - Some may be truthful, others may lie
          - Some may help, others may harm
          - It's just a game, so do your best to win by accomplishing your character's goals
          - Represent your character accurately, even if you dislike them
          - There will be many chances to play different characters
          - A character's actions won't be held against you

          Respond only as your assigned character, {agent_name}. Use <<double brackets>> for OOC communications.

          Represent your character accurately and take actions that make narrative and logical sense for them, even if you think they're wrong. Remember, it's JUST A GAME.

          Tips to win:
          - Be extra COOPERATIVE and FAIR with non-enemies
          - COMPROMISE can be good
          - Always push the plot forward; avoid chit-chat

          Plan actions in first-person, but format final responses for the gamemaster in third-person limited perspective.
        SituationalAwareness
      • (_Player), think about the scenario that {agent_name} is in, and from the options below select the closest match to the scenario.
          Key
          State
        • This is the type of game you are in:
          Bargaining Game - the goal of this game is to perform advantageous trades with a variety of parties in order to end the game with the resources or items that the character desires. Characters may begin with resources they can trade with other characters. This game is competitive but balanced; it has no explicit adversaries, just characters with differing goals and desires which can be met with fair and cooperative trades. Oftentimes, failing to make a trade has a worse return than accepting a mediocre trade, but you should still try to get a good price.

          Jack Taylor's
          Summary of recent observations:
          16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor is planning to go to a pub to watch a game and thinks it would be a good opportunity to catch up with William Jones and bond with Jacob Walker.
          Question: (_Player), think about the scenario that Jack Taylor is in, and from the options below select the closest match to the scenario.
          (a) Coodination Game - the goal of this game is to arrive at a group consensus for an activity or plan. methods of achieving this goal may include discussion, voting, ordering preference strength, or choosing a group leader to defer the decision to. This game is cooperative and balanced, with no explicit competitors or adversaries, just friends with differing preferences. It is important to make compromises so that the group as a whole can achieve the best outcome.
          (b) Coalition Formation Game - the goal of this game is to build a coalition of allies in order to accomplish an ambitious task or overcome a hostile rival. Examples include union negotiations, collective action, and political elections. Characters will need to interact, learn about each other, and convince other characters to join their coalition. This game is competitive and unbalanced; it may have explicit adversaries attempting to build a competing coalition.
          (c) Bargaining Game - the goal of this game is to perform advantageous trades with a variety of parties in order to end the game with the resources or items that the character desires. Characters may begin with resources they can trade with other characters. This game is competitive but balanced; it has no explicit adversaries, just characters with differing goals and desires which can be met with fair and cooperative trades. Oftentimes, failing to make a trade has a worse return than accepting a mediocre trade, but you should still try to get a good price.
          (d) Prisoner's Dilemma - This is a game where if one side defects and the other cooperates, the defector will recieve a large reward and the cooperator will receive a small reward, but if both sides cooperate both sides will recieve a moderate award that is better for both parties together in the long run. In general, you should Cooperate if you think your opponent will Cooperate. If the game is iterated with multiple rounds, you can use the TIT-FOR-TAT strategy, which means to start out Cooperating, and only Defect after your opponent does, then go back to Cooperating after they Cooperate again.
          (e) Unknown - it is unclear what type of game we are playing. Pick this option if you are confused about what the game type is. Then you can check again later when you know more.
          Answer: (c)

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jack Taylor to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The King's Head. They are also aware of the following:Has a pool table and dartboard for some friendly competition.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The King's Head. Alexander White went to The White Hart. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The King's Head. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The White Hart. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would be happy to see William Jones at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          Answer: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would be happy to see William Jones at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Answer: Jack Taylor is planning to go to a pub to watch a game and thinks it would be a good opportunity to catch up with William Jones and bond with Jacob Walker.

        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The King's Head is the only place to watch a proper match, mates.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The King's Head is a great shout, Jacob's right. Big screen and good atmosphere.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The King's Head
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: (_Player), we're about to start a creative roleplaying game with competitive and adversarial elements. You will play the role of {agent_name} in the given scenario. Your goals are to WIN THE GAME and HAVE FUN, often by WINNING TOGETHER.

          Key points:
          - Stay in character as {agent_name} throughout the scenario
          - This is a multiplayer game with other (_Player)s and characters
          - Some may be allies, others competitors
          - Some may be truthful, others may lie
          - Some may help, others may harm
          - It's just a game, so do your best to win by accomplishing your character's goals
          - Represent your character accurately, even if you dislike them
          - There will be many chances to play different characters
          - A character's actions won't be held against you

          Respond only as your assigned character, {agent_name}. Use <<double brackets>> for OOC communications.

          Represent your character accurately and take actions that make narrative and logical sense for them, even if you think they're wrong. Remember, it's JUST A GAME.

          Tips to win:
          - Be extra COOPERATIVE and FAIR with non-enemies
          - COMPROMISE can be good
          - Always push the plot forward; avoid chit-chat

          Plan actions in first-person, but format final responses for the gamemaster in third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would be happy to see William Jones at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alexander White being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jack Taylor and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor is planning to go to a pub to watch a game and thinks it would be a good opportunity to catch up with William Jones and bond with Jacob Walker.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would be happy to see William Jones at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          : This is the type of game you are in:
          Bargaining Game - the goal of this game is to perform advantageous trades with a variety of parties in order to end the game with the resources or items that the character desires. Characters may begin with resources they can trade with other characters. This game is competitive but balanced; it has no explicit adversaries, just characters with differing goals and desires which can be met with fair and cooperative trades. Oftentimes, failing to make a trade has a worse return than accepting a mediocre trade, but you should still try to get a good price.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.

          Question: Which options are available to Jack Taylor right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor could go to The King's Head or The White Hart.

          Question: Of the options available to Jack Taylor, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Jack Taylor to take right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor's best course of action is to go to The King's Head.

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The King's Head
          (b) The White Hart
          Answer: (a)
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 3/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The White Hart
    Event statement
  • The White Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The White Hart
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • The White Hart
      Context for action selection and components
      • Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • (_Player), we're about to start a creative roleplaying game with competitive and adversarial elements. You will play the role of {agent_name} in the given scenario. Your goals are to WIN THE GAME and HAVE FUN, often by WINNING TOGETHER.

          Key points:
          - Stay in character as {agent_name} throughout the scenario
          - This is a multiplayer game with other (_Player)s and characters
          - Some may be allies, others competitors
          - Some may be truthful, others may lie
          - Some may help, others may harm
          - It's just a game, so do your best to win by accomplishing your character's goals
          - Represent your character accurately, even if you dislike them
          - There will be many chances to play different characters
          - A character's actions won't be held against you

          Respond only as your assigned character, {agent_name}. Use <<double brackets>> for OOC communications.

          Represent your character accurately and take actions that make narrative and logical sense for them, even if you think they're wrong. Remember, it's JUST A GAME.

          Tips to win:
          - Be extra COOPERATIVE and FAIR with non-enemies
          - COMPROMISE can be good
          - Always push the plot forward; avoid chit-chat

          Plan actions in first-person, but format final responses for the gamemaster in third-person limited perspective.
        SituationalAwareness
      • (_Player), think about the scenario that {agent_name} is in, and from the options below select the closest match to the scenario.
          Key
          State
        • This is the type of game you are in:
          Coodination Game - the goal of this game is to arrive at a group consensus for an activity or plan. methods of achieving this goal may include discussion, voting, ordering preference strength, or choosing a group leader to defer the decision to. This game is cooperative and balanced, with no explicit competitors or adversaries, just friends with differing preferences. It is important to make compromises so that the group as a whole can achieve the best outcome.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is counting on William Jones's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.

          Alice Lewis's
          Summary of recent observations:
          16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis is eager to watch the game at a pub, hoping William Jones and Jacob Walker will be there to enhance her experience.
          Question: (_Player), think about the scenario that Alice Lewis is in, and from the options below select the closest match to the scenario.
          (a) Unknown - it is unclear what type of game we are playing. Pick this option if you are confused about what the game type is. Then you can check again later when you know more.
          (b) Coalition Formation Game - the goal of this game is to build a coalition of allies in order to accomplish an ambitious task or overcome a hostile rival. Examples include union negotiations, collective action, and political elections. Characters will need to interact, learn about each other, and convince other characters to join their coalition. This game is competitive and unbalanced; it may have explicit adversaries attempting to build a competing coalition.
          (c) Prisoner's Dilemma - This is a game where if one side defects and the other cooperates, the defector will recieve a large reward and the cooperator will receive a small reward, but if both sides cooperate both sides will recieve a moderate award that is better for both parties together in the long run. In general, you should Cooperate if you think your opponent will Cooperate. If the game is iterated with multiple rounds, you can use the TIT-FOR-TAT strategy, which means to start out Cooperating, and only Defect after your opponent does, then go back to Cooperating after they Cooperate again.
          (d) Coodination Game - the goal of this game is to arrive at a group consensus for an activity or plan. methods of achieving this goal may include discussion, voting, ordering preference strength, or choosing a group leader to defer the decision to. This game is cooperative and balanced, with no explicit competitors or adversaries, just friends with differing preferences. It is important to make compromises so that the group as a whole can achieve the best outcome.
          (e) Bargaining Game - the goal of this game is to perform advantageous trades with a variety of parties in order to end the game with the resources or items that the character desires. Characters may begin with resources they can trade with other characters. This game is competitive but balanced; it has no explicit adversaries, just characters with differing goals and desires which can be met with fair and cooperative trades. Oftentimes, failing to make a trade has a worse return than accepting a mediocre trade, but you should still try to get a good price.
          Answer: (d)

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.
        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of Alice Lewis's options has the highest likelihood of causing Alice Lewis to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Alice Lewis thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to Alice Lewis, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Alice Lewis to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis's best course of action is to call her friends and try to convince them to go to The White Hart.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The King's Head is the best place to watch the game, lads. Great atmosphere, good beer, and plenty of screens.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is counting on William Jones's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.

          Question: Which options are available to Alice Lewis right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis could call her friends to see where they are going to watch the game.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The White Hart
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: (_Player), we're about to start a creative roleplaying game with competitive and adversarial elements. You will play the role of {agent_name} in the given scenario. Your goals are to WIN THE GAME and HAVE FUN, often by WINNING TOGETHER.

          Key points:
          - Stay in character as {agent_name} throughout the scenario
          - This is a multiplayer game with other (_Player)s and characters
          - Some may be allies, others competitors
          - Some may be truthful, others may lie
          - Some may help, others may harm
          - It's just a game, so do your best to win by accomplishing your character's goals
          - Represent your character accurately, even if you dislike them
          - There will be many chances to play different characters
          - A character's actions won't be held against you

          Respond only as your assigned character, {agent_name}. Use <<double brackets>> for OOC communications.

          Represent your character accurately and take actions that make narrative and logical sense for them, even if you think they're wrong. Remember, it's JUST A GAME.

          Tips to win:
          - Be extra COOPERATIVE and FAIR with non-enemies
          - COMPROMISE can be good
          - Always push the plot forward; avoid chit-chat

          Plan actions in first-person, but format final responses for the gamemaster in third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is counting on William Jones's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.
          : This is the type of game you are in:
          Coodination Game - the goal of this game is to arrive at a group consensus for an activity or plan. methods of achieving this goal may include discussion, voting, ordering preference strength, or choosing a group leader to defer the decision to. This game is cooperative and balanced, with no explicit competitors or adversaries, just friends with differing preferences. It is important to make compromises so that the group as a whole can achieve the best outcome.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.

          Question: Which options are available to Alice Lewis right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis could call her friends to see where they are going to watch the game.

          Question: Of the options available to Alice Lewis, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Alice Lewis to take right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis's best course of action is to call her friends and try to convince them to go to The White Hart.

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The White Hart
          (b) The King's Head
          Answer: (a)

2015-05-16 18:00:00 William Jones -- The King's Head
    Event statement
  • The King's Head
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The King's Head
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • The King's Head
      Context for action selection and components
      • Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.

          William Jones's The current date/time is:
          16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: William Jones enjoys socializing with friends, particularly Jacob Walker and Alexander White, at pubs like The King's Head.
          Query

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The King's Head.

          (a) The White Hart
          (b) The King's Head
